contentrichtext.text: {{About|the Formula One driver|the King, Kenneth MacAlpin|Kenneth MacAlpin}} {{Infobox F1 driver| name = Kenneth McAlpine | nationality = {{flagicon|UK}} [[United Kingdom|British]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1920|9|21|df=y}} | Years = {{F1|1952}}-{{F1|1953}}, {{F1|1955}} | Team(s) = [[Connaught Engineering|Connaught]] | Races = 7 | Championships = 0 | Wins = 0 | Podiums = 0 | Points = 0 | Poles = 0 | Fastest laps = 0 | First race = [[1952 British Grand Prix]] | First win = | Last win = | Last race = [[1955 British Grand Prix]] | }} '''Kenneth McAlpine''' (born September 21, 1920) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] former [[racing driver]] from [[England]]. He was born in [[Cobham, Surrey|Cobham]], [[Surrey]].<ref name="WATN">{{cite web |url=http://www.oldracingcars.com/driver/Kenneth_McAlpine |title= The World Championship drivers - Where are they now? |accessdate=2007-07-29 |last=Jenkins |first=Richard |publisher=OldRacingCars.com}}</ref> He participated in 7 [[Formula One]] World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on July 19, 1952. He scored no championship points. He is a member of the [[Sir Robert McAlpine|McAlpine]] family that started the famous civil engineering company of the same name. He is also a member of [[The Air Squadron]]. ==Complete Formula One World Championship results== ([[:Template:F1 driver results legend 2|key]]) {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" !
